Header: President vows to dedicate himself to fulfilling responsibilities entrusted to him
Content: President Maithripala Sirisena, while addressing an event held in Haggala this morning, stated that instead of following the insults, slander and criticisms levelled against him, he will dedicate himself to fulfill the responsibilities entrusted to him, President Sirisena noted that the if the problems in the country, which are considered and spoken of as major problems by certain persons in the country, are actually problems which can be resolved when looked at patiently and indifferently, in comparison with other countries in the world Minister of Plantations,Navin Dissanayake pointed out that, as of late, various views are being expressed regarding the country’s national security and just because a few explosives were found in Jaffna, this is being portrayed as a major incident in an attempt to brainwash the public. He went on to point out that explosive items would definitely emerge after a thirty year war but faith must be kept in the country’s President who is the Defense Minister. He is the Head of the Defense Council, so there must be faith that he will take the decision on safeguarding the country’s security, sovereignty and unitary state. The newly-constructed Vahalkada at the Sri Sankagiri Viharaya in Haggala was declared under the auspices of President Maithripala Sirisena on Monday. A large group including the Maha Sangha and several ministers and public representatives were present for the occasion. Following the ceremony, President Maithripala Sirisena called on the Chief Incumbent of the Sri Sankagiri Viharaya Venerable Bibile Gunananda Thera and looked into his well-being.
